sentences.en: All flashed indignant or appealing glances at the inexorable Davis.
sentences.cn: 大家都把愤怒、哀求的目光投向冷酷无情的戴维.

sentences.en: Basically prejudiced book calculated to make White Liberals feel comfortably indignant.
sentences.cn: 偏见的书,目的是使白人自由主义者看了生一点无伤大雅的气.

sentences.en: Everybody was puzzled, and nineteen couples were surprised and indignant.
sentences.cn: 事出意外,人人都大惑不解, 那十九对夫妇更是怒气冲冲.

sentences.en: He is indignant at suggestions that they were secret agents.
sentences.cn: 有人暗示他们可能是特务，这让他非常气愤。

sentences.en: He went home ashamed and indignant, full of rage.
sentences.cn: 他羞愤交集地回到家里, 怒火满腔.

sentences.en: I was indignant at their mean actions.
sentences.cn: 我对他们的卑劣行径感到愤慨.

sentences.en: I was indignant because I felt that I had been punished unfairly.
sentences.cn: 我非常愤慨,因为我觉得对我的惩罚是不公平的.

sentences.en: She didn't know whether to feel flattered or indignant.
sentences.cn: 她不知道应该感到高兴还是愤怒。

sentences.en: She felt as indignant as if her own money had been squandered.
sentences.cn: 她心里十分生气,好像是她自己的钱给浪费掉了似的.

sentences.en: She was indignant with his presumption and self - satisfaction and conscious rectitude.
sentences.cn: 她恼火他的傲慢自满和自以为是.

sentences.en: She was very indignant at the way she had been treated.
sentences.cn: 她对于自己受到的待遇大为光火。

sentences.en: She waxes righteously indignant if anyone tries to contradict her.
sentences.cn: 如果有人想反驳她,她说起话来就会义愤填膺.

sentences.en: Sheena gave her an indignant look.
sentences.cn: 希娜愤怒地看了她一眼。

sentences.en: The indignant customer complained to the manager.
sentences.cn: 那个愤怒的顾客向经理投诉.

sentences.en: They are indignant at [ about ] the increased prices.
sentences.cn: 他们对涨价很 气愤.

trans.tran_cn: 愤怒的，愤慨的，愤愤不平的，激愤
trans.tran_en: angry and surprised because you feel insulted or unfairly treated
